title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #37**: Essential Components and Lacunary Sets

**Question**: Can a lacunary set A ⊂ ℕ be an essential component?

**Answer**: NO (Ruzsa 1987)

**Key Definitions**:
- **Essential component**: A set where d_s(A + B) > d_s(B) for all B with 0 < d_s(B) < 1
- **Lacunary set**: Elements grow exponentially (e.g., {2^n})

**Ruzsa's Theorem**: Essential components must have |A ∩ {1,...,N}| ≥ (log N)^{1+c} for some c > 0. Lacunary sets only have O(log N) elements.
